item.title: Xbox Will Not Mandate the Use of AI, Confirms Phil Spencer
item.content:encoded:
Phil Spencer has revealed that there is no top-down mandate to use AI for Xbox.

Some new details about Xbox have surfaced recently through an interview with the president, Sarah Bond. Bond recently stated that the idea of exclusive games is now antiquated. She also confirmed that Series X/S successors are in development. Now, a new interview with Phil Spencer talks about Xbox’s approach to AI.

Xbox Lets Creative Teams Choose Whether They Want to Use AI

As reported by IGN, during a panel at the Paley International Council Summit in Palo Alto, California (moderated by Double Fine Studio Head Tim Schafer), Phil Spencer spoke about the use of AI at Xbox. Spencer first spoke about how most use is focused on the “security and protection” of their networks. He added that the scale has grown so much that people alone cannot ensure safety.

Which is why they use AI to keep a check on the conversation and topics, protect child accounts, see who gets to talk to those people, and whether the account is locked down by parents or guardians who are setting those controls.

On the creative side of things at Xbox, AI use is left to the teams. Spencer explains that he has “found that creative teams will use tools that make their job easier when it makes their job easier, and any top-down mandate that ‘Thou must use a certain tool’…is not really a path to success.” The process is to make tools available for the teams and let things “organically percolate”.

In other news, Fallout 76’s Xbox Series X/S upgrade will arrive in 2026. Additionally, Microsoft wants Xbox to achieve a 30% profit margin, well above the industry standard. What are your thoughts on Xbox not mandating AI usage? Let us know through the official Insider Gaming Discord.

item.title: Baldur’s Gate 3 Could Potentially Come to the Switch 2
item.content:encoded:
It seems that 2023’s Game of the Year, Baldur’s Gate 3, could make its way to the Nintendo Switch 2.

The Switch 2 is set to receive a whole bunch of new titles in the coming days, with Metroid Prime 4 and Assassin’s Creed Shadows arriving in December 2025, followed by Fallout 4 anniversary edition in 2026. It seems that the next title Nintendo could be looking to add to its third-party collection is Larian Studios’ critically acclaimed hit.

Baldur’s Gate 3 Could be a Great Third-Party Addition for the Switch 2

The talk about Baldur’s Gate 3 coming to the Switch 2 originates from NateTheHate’s recent reply on X (formerly Twitter). In one of his recent replies, the insider was asked whether he had any updates for Red Dead Redemption 2’s launch for the platform. To which he replied, stating he doesn’t have anything new on RDR2, but he has “heard something on BG3 for SW2”. However, he needs “more verification” before he can share anything. In a later reply, Nate stated that he will update on this topic soon.

Baldur’s Gate 3 is a solid choice for Nintendo Switch 2 as it’s one of the most decorated titles out there. In April 2024, the title became the first game to win Game of the Year at all five major award ceremonies, including the Golden Joystick Awards, the Game Developers’ Choice Awards, the DICE Awards, the BAFTAs, and The Game Awards. The game has also received a lot of post-launch love from the developers, including loads of new content and enhancements to improve the gameplay experience.

In other news, Metroid Prime 4 gameplay has surfaced through unlisted Switch 2 ads. Additionally, here is what Baldur’s Gate 3’s publishing lead has to say about Nintendo’s character summons patent. What are your thoughts on Baldur’s Gate 3 coming to Switch 2? Let us know through the official Insider Gaming Discord.

item.title: Copenhagen Gaming Week 2026 Dates, Location, and Information
item.content:encoded:
Copenhagen Gaming Week 2026 is one of the smaller international gaming events, attracting tens of thousands of attendees to the Bella Center in Copenhagen, Denmark. Described as “fun for the whole family”, it’s an event that you don’t want to miss if you’re local to the area or visiting Denmark around the same time it’s running.

In this quick guide, we’ll be telling you everything you need to know about Copenhagen Gaming Week 2026.

Copenhagen Gaming Week 2026 Dates

The dates for Copenhagen Gaming Week 2026 have been confirmed to take place from February 12th to February 14th, 2026.

Copenhagen Gaming Week 2026 Location

Copenhagen Gaming Week 2026 will be held at the Bella Center in Copenhagen, Denmark. The full address for Bella Center Copenhagen is Center Boulevard 5, 2300 Copenhagen S, Denmark. 

The closest airport to Copenhagen Gaming Week 2026 at the Bella Center is Copenhagen Airport (CPH), which is a ten-minute taxi ride to the venue. Hotels, restaurants, bars, and other activities are all located fairly close to the event, but be quick, hotel accommodations closest to the event usually fill up fast.

When Can I Get Copenhagen Gaming Week 2026 Tickets?

Tickets for Copenhagen Gaming Week 2026 can be found on the Ticketmaster Danmark here, or alternatively on Stubhub here. At the time of writing, tickets are currently not available, but make sure you double-check the links above as they may have since gone live.

Overall, Copenhagen Gaming Week 2026 is an excellent event for all of the family with plenty of video games, technology, and more to check out. The official event description for the event reads,

“Enter a world where games, sports, play, and technology meet, and experience this year’s festival for the whole family. Copenhagen Gaming Week is more than gaming – it’s a celebration of community and the joy of playing, whether you’re into esports, trading cards, football, or board games. Here you can experience the latest technologies, explore digital trends and be inspired by talks and debates that focus on gaming and culture.”

Will you be going to Copenhagen Gaming Week 2026? If you found this guide helpful, you can find all the other games industry events for 2026 on the Insider Gaming calendar.

item.title: Battlefield: RedSec Is Battlefield 6’s New Battle Royale Mode
item.content:encoded:
A fresh story has revealed that Battlefield: RedSec is the name for the rebranded battle royale game mode coming in Battlefield 6. ‘Firestorm’ is now a thing of the past, and BF 6 is gearing up for its strongly rumored October 28 battle royale shadow drop.

We’ve known for weeks that Battlefield 6 is getting a Battle Royale mode. It features an innovative insta-death circle mechanic, and a datamine revealed that the Battle Royale is to release on October 28. Now, we’ve learned the new game mode’s full title.

Battlefield: RedSec Is The Name Of Battlefield 6 Battle Royale

Get ready to enter Battlefield: RedSec!

Thanks to ModernWarzone‘s exclusive story, we’ve learned that this is the new name for EA’s rebranded, free-to-play battle royale mode in Battlefield 6.

Here’s what they’ve said about the news:

“EXCLUSIVE: The F2P Battlefield 6 battle royale is officially named “Battlefield: RedSec”. Releasing October 28th as previously reported, however, it looks like there won’t be any trailers or official announcements until the 28th itself, instead of a day before. Full on shadowdrop.”

This doesn’t alter the gameplay in any way, but it is a cool name. It’s unclear if this is a way to get clear of Firestorm and start anew, or if Battlefield Studios is simply looking for a fresh relaunch.

Either way, the shadow drop is looking less like a shadow drop and more like a surprise birthday party where everyone knows it’s happening. Still, EA will be looking to right the wrongs of Firestorm and hope Battlefield: RedSec is the start of something special.

So, what do you think of the new name? Is it in keeping with the military aspect of the Battlefield brand? More importantly, is it an improvement over Firestorm? Let us know your thoughts and more through the Insider Gaming Discord and the comments section below.
